item.title: Q&A: What Does The Senate Health Bill Mean For Me?
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The Senate Republicans' plan to overhaul the Affordable Care Act could bring big changes to many Americans' health care coverage. Here are answers to a handful of scenarios from concerned listeners.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The Senate Republicans' plan to overhaul the Affordable Care Act could bring big changes to many Americans' health care coverage. Here are answers to a handful of scenarios from concerned listeners. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534576392/q-a-what-does-the-senate-health-bill-mean-for-me

item.title: Senate GOP Leaders Postpone Health Care Vote Until After July 4th
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Senate Republican leaders are delaying a vote on their bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, with many senators left to convince.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Senate Republican leaders are delaying a vote on their bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, with many senators left to convince. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597188/senate-gop-leaders-postpone-health-care-vote-until-after-july-4th

item.title: Kaiser CEO Grapples With Potential Impact Of Senate GOP Health Care Bill
item.description: June 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Drew Altman, president and CEO of the Kaiser Family Foundation, about his reactions to the health care bill proposed by Senate Republicans and why health care in America is so expensive.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Drew Altman, president and CEO of the Kaiser Family Foundation, about his reactions to the health care bill proposed by Senate Republicans and why health care in America is so expensive. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597143/kaiser-ceo-grapples-with-potential-impact-of-senate-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: Senate Republican Leaders Delay Vote On Health Care Bill
item.description: June 27, 2017 - President Trump huddled with Republican senators on Tuesday to discuss the Senate's health care bill. Republican leaders decided to delay a vote on the measure amid concern it doesn't have enough support to pass.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - President Trump huddled with Republican senators on Tuesday to discuss the Senate's health care bill. Republican leaders decided to delay a vote on the measure amid concern it doesn't have enough support to pass. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597136/senate-republican-leaders-delay-vote-on-health-care-bill

item.title: Considering Breast-Feeding? This Guide Can Help
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The vast majority of pregnant women in the U.S. say they plan to breast-feed, but aren't told that many new moms worldwide find it tricky. Being mentored the first weeks after birth can help a lot.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The vast majority of pregnant women in the U.S. say they plan to breast-feed, but aren't told that many new moms worldwide find it tricky. Being mentored the first weeks after birth can help a lot. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534123212/considering-breast-feeding-here-s-how-to-make-it-easier

item.title: Have We Missed The Point On Health Care?
item.description:
June 27, 2017 - It's the final countdown for Republican plans to repeal and replace Obamacare. But what if neither plan gets to the heart of how to make America healthy again?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/have-we-missed-the-point-on-healthcare
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - It's the final countdown for Republican plans to repeal and replace Obamacare. But what if neither plan gets to the heart of how to make America healthy again? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/have-we-missed-the-point-on-healthcare

item.title: CHART: CBO Weighs Who Wins, Who Loses With Senate Health Care Bill
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office estimates that 22 million people would lose coverage with the Senate bill. That includes 15 million people on Medicaid, and others who could no longer afford insurance.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office estimates that 22 million people would lose coverage with the Senate bill. That includes 15 million people on Medicaid, and others who could no longer afford insurance. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534465505/chart-cbo-weighs-who-wins-who-loses-with-senate-health-care-bill

item.title: From Birth To Death, Medicaid Affects The Lives Of Millions
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Medicaid has become a prime target of Republicans in Congress who want to rein in the program's costs, which totaled $350 billion in 2015. We take a look at what all that money pays for.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Medicaid has become a prime target of Republicans in Congress who want to rein in the program's costs, which totaled $350 billion in 2015. We take a look at what all that money pays for. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534436521/from-birth-to-death-medicaid-affects-the-lives-of-millions

item.title: Enrollees Who Work Still Need Medicaid, Kaiser Survey Shows
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks to Diane Rowland of the Kaiser Family Foundation, about a misconception: If a person on Medicaid gets a job, than their health insurance needs will be taken care of.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks to Diane Rowland of the Kaiser Family Foundation, about a misconception: If a person on Medicaid gets a job, than their health insurance needs will be taken care of. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534516199/enrollees-who-work-often-still-need-medicaid-kaiser-survey-shows

item.title: GOP Sen. Susan Collins Plans To Oppose Senate Health Bill After CBO Report
item.description: June 26, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office said Monday 22 million more people would be uninsured over the next decade under the Senate health care bill. Maine Sen. Collins later said she would oppose the bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office said Monday 22 million more people would be uninsured over the next decade under the Senate health care bill. Maine Sen. Collins later said she would oppose the bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534480885/gop-sen-susan-collins-plans-to-oppose-senate-health-bill-after-cbo-report

item.title: GOP Sen. Susan Collins Firmly Opposes Senate Health Care Bill
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Sen. Collins says she wants to reform flaws in the Affordable Care Act. This comes after the Congressional Budget Office said the Senate bill would leave 22 million more people uninsured by 2026.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Sen. Collins says she wants to reform flaws in the Affordable Care Act. This comes after the Congressional Budget Office said the Senate bill would leave 22 million more people uninsured by 2026. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534477740/gop-sen-susan-collins-firmly-opposes-senate-health-care-bill

item.title: Routine DNA Sequencing May Be Helpful And Not As Scary As Feared
item.description: June 26, 2017 - A study of whole genome sequencing found that while many people discovered genetic variations linked to rare diseases, they didn't overreact to the news.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - A study of whole genome sequencing found that while many people discovered genetic variations linked to rare diseases, they didn't overreact to the news. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/26/534338576/routine-dna-sequencing-may-be-helpful-and-not-as-scary-as-feared

item.title: GOP Senate Bill Would Cut Health Care Coverage By 22 Million
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Congressional forecasters say a Senate Republican bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act would leave 22 million more people uninsured in the next decade.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Congressional forecasters say a Senate Republican bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act would leave 22 million more people uninsured in the next decade. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534432433/gop-senate-bill-would-cut-health-care-coverage-by-22-million

item.title: In Texas, Opponents Rally Against Senate Republican Health Care Bill
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Despite its politicians' positions, many people who live in Texas' rural hill country came out this weekend in support of the existing health care law. But some near the gathering support Obamacare repeal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Despite its politicians' positions, many people who live in Texas' rural hill country came out this weekend in support of the existing health care law. But some near the gathering support Obamacare repeal. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534448022/in-texas-opponents-rally-against-senate-republican-health-care-bill

item.title: Congressional Budget Office To Announce Score Of GOP Health Care Bill
item.description:
June 26, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office plans to announce its score of the Senate Republican health care bill.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534447897/congressional-budget-office-to-announce-score-of-gop-health-care-bill
